instructions: Participants made direct ordinal judgments about the likelihood of outcomes in small vs. large samples.

items.question: A certain town is served by two hospitals. In the larger hospital about 45 babies are born each day, and in the smaller hospital about 15 babies are born each day. About 50% of all babies are boys. For a period of 1 year, each hospital recorded the days on which (more/less) than 60% of the babies born were boys. Which hospital do you think recorded more such days?
options: About the same (within 5% of each other)

items.question: An investigator computed the average word-length in every page of a book. Another investigator took the first line in each page and computed the lineâ€™s average word-length. The average word-length in the entire book is four. The first investigator counted the number of pages that had an average word-length of 6 or (more/less) and the second investigator counted the number of lines that had an average word-length of 6 or (more/less). Which investigator do you think recorded a larger number of such units?
options: About the same (within 5% of each other)

items.question: Two teams are collecting data. One checks three men a day, and the other checks one man a day. Average height is 5 ft 10 in. The team checking three men ranks them and counts the days on which the height of the middle man is (more/less) than 5 ft 11 in. The other team counts the days on which the man they checked was (taller/shorter) than 5 ft 11 in. Which team counted more such days?
options: About the same (within 5% of each other)
